Manx: Padjer son ooilley ny ta goaill ayrn ayns yn chaggey:
English: A prayer for all who are taking part in the war:
Diplomatic: Padjer son ooilley ny ta ghoaill ayrn ayns yn chaggey

Manx: Oh, Yee Ooilley Niartal,
English: O God Almighty,
Diplomatic: Oh, Yee ooilley nhiartal

Manx: Chiarn dty Heshaght Chaggee Flaunysagh,
English: Lord of your Celestial Army,
Diplomatic: Chiarn dy heshaght chaggee flaunysagh

Manx: Jeeagh neose orrin ta shin dy imlee guee ort,
English: Look down upon us, we humbly beseech of thee,
Diplomatic: Jeeagh neose orryn ta shin dy imlee guee ort.

Manx: Lesh foayr er nyn sheshaght chaggee,
English: With favour on our army,
Diplomatic: Lesh fooar er nyn sheshaght chaggee.

Manx: Nish ta goaill ayrn ayns yn chaggey,
English: Now taking part in the war,
Diplomatic: Nish ta ghoaill ayrn ayns yn chaggey.

Manx: As cur daue yn attey dy varriaght.
English: And give them the crown of victory.
Diplomatic: As cur daue yn attey dy varriagh.

Manx: Coodee nyn ghing ayns laa yn chaggey.
English: Cover their heads in the day of battle,
Diplomatic: Cooddee nyn ghing ayns laa yn chaggey.

Manx: Cur daue yn dunnalys shen ta çheet voish credjue.
English: Give them that courage that comes from faith,
Diplomatic: Chur da ue yn dunnalys shen ta cheet voish credjue.

Manx: As yn vyghin shen ta cairagh da sidooryn chreestee.
English: And the mercy that is proper for christian soldiers.
Diplomatic: As yn vyghyn shen ta cairagh da sidooryn chreestee.

Manx: Gow çhymmey orroosyn ta surranse,
English: Take pity of those that suffer,
Diplomatic: Ghow chymmey orroosyn ta surrans,

Manx: As adsyn ta çhing as lhottit.
English: And those that are sick and wounded,
Diplomatic: as adsyn ta ching as lottyt.

Manx: Adsyn ta gheddyn baase.
English: Those that are dying,
Diplomatic: Adsyn ta gheddyn baase.

Manx: As adsyn ta dobberan son ocsyn ta er duittym.
English: And those that mourn for those who have fallen,
Diplomatic: As adsyn ta dhobberon. son ocksyn ta er duittym.

Manx: Chur lesh yn chaggey,
English: Bring the war,
Diplomatic: Chur lesh yn chaggey.

Manx: My te Dty aigney,
English: If it is Your will,
Diplomatic: My te Dy aigney,

Manx: Gys shee cairagh, as beayn.
English: To a fair and permanent peace,
Diplomatic: gys shee cairagh, as beeayn.

Manx: As gow yn ard reiltys harrish ooilley ny reddyn
English: And take chief governance over all things
Diplomatic: As gow yn Ard reiltys harrish ooilley ny reddyn

Manx: Ayns yn seihll shoh dy pheccah as seaghyn.
English: In this world of sin and sorrow.
Diplomatic: ayns yn seihll shoh dy feccah as seaghyn.

Manx: Gys sheeney magh Dty reeriaght.
English: Unto the expansion of Your kingdom,
Diplomatic: Gys sheeney magh dy reeraght

Manx: Er yn coontey Eckysyn ta nyn shee;
English: On account of He who is our peace;
Diplomatic: Er yn coontey Eckysyn ta nyn shee.

Manx: Yeesey Chreest, nyn Jiarn.
English: Jesus Christ, our Lord.
Diplomatic: Yeesey Chreest, nyn jhiarn.

Manx: Amen.
English: Amen
Diplomatic: Amen.
January 28th 1900
